content.text: Users often don't want a list of documents; they want an answer. QA systems extract specific facts or generate responses from a corpus.
content.hook: Search: 'Where is Tokyo?' -> [Link 1, Link 2]. QA: 'Where is Tokyo?' -> 'Tokyo is in Japan.'

steps: Question Processing: Determine 'Answer Type' (Person, Date, etc).
Answer Extraction: Pinpoint the exact string in the text.
Ranking: Choose the most confident answer.

content.text: QA relies heavily on Natural Language Processing (NLP) techniques like Named Entity Recognition (NER), Part-of-Speech tagging, and Semantic Parsing.
content.hook: Modern QA systems (like LLMs) generate answers by predicting next tokens, but traditional systems 'highlight' existing facts.

content.description: Text: 'Dr. Muzamil founded the IR lab in 2024.' Question: 'Who founded the lab?' What part of speech is the answer? What entity type?
